alert.note: Alert for Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 5:01PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central St. Tammany, south central Washington Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and southwestern Pearl River Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 501 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sun to 9 miles south of Madisonville. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and tropical funnel clouds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Covington, Abita Springs, Madisonville, Sun, Bush, Lacombe and Slidell Airport. This includes Interstate 12 between mile markers 59 and 81. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
